channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.description:
Report X-2024020975

X-2024020975 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVE FOR UNLOAD BY AN MANAGER PUT ON A CART THEN BROUGHT TO HAZMAT CAGE DescribePack: THE CAPS LOOSENED SEALS FAILED NO HOLES OR CRACKS DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PUT IN TO A HAZMAT TOTE WITH BAG. 2. item.title: Report X-2024020847
item.description:
Report X-2024020847

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-01
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and removed from workflow. Package was brought to QA cage for inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Both five-liter bottles have loose caps, leaked. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of oxidizing/corrosive liquid.

item.title: Report X-2024020810
item.description:
Report X-2024020810

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet, damaged package was unloaded from trailer and removed from workflow without sending to overhead sorter. Package was left on SWAK scale rollers in Unload area for QA member inspection. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: One of the twenty-four aerosol cans is crushed at its base. Aluminum sidewall tore away from base, permitting discharge of virtually all contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a plastic tote to prevent further release or seepage of flammable liquid.

item.title: Report I-2023120023
item.description:
Report I-2023120023

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-08
  • City: NEW LONDON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CITY OIL CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver handed Coast Guard Employees the nozzle. Coast Guard employee unhooked nozzle in error which caused the release of 17gals of fuel. Area was boomed immediately then cleaned up by Environmental Services.
